intro: Carpodinus umbellata, commonly known as the umbrella sedge, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges and grass-like plants. The plant features slender, triangular stems with whorled leaves that give it a distinctive appearance. Its inflorescence consists of an umbel-like cluster of small, three-lobed flowers. The botanical characteristics of Carpodinus umbellata make it a notable species in wetland ecosystems.
